text: James Aloysius Hickey (October 11, 1920 â€“ October 24, 2004) was an American Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church. He was Archbishop of Washington from 1980 to 2000. He was made a Cardinal in 1988. He was born in Midland, Michigan. Hickey died on October 24, 2004 in Washington, D.C. of pneumonia, aged 84.Cardinal James A. Hickey of Washington Dies at 84 at The New York Times ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:American cardinals Category:Writers from Michigan Category:Writers from Washington, D.C. title: James Aloysius Hickey
